title: What is the meaning of 'You got me'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most usual use of the expression “You got me” is as a retort when someone tests your knowledge as to some fact and you don’t know the answer. Thus if someone asked you. “Do you know the total number of Women who were secretly take up the back staircase of the White House to have sex with President Kennedy in order to releive his ailing back?” - and like most of us you did not know the exact number - you might say “You got me” meaning I do not know the answer.

Surely this depends on context and tone. It could mean "Do you understand what I am saying, and how seriously I mean it?" As in, "If I ever catch you looking at my girl again, I'll rip your nards off! You got me?" It could be a recognition of understanding, as in "When I said I needed space and you allowed me to spend time alone, I felt like you got me." It could be a response to disappointment. "Oh, I was expecting a sexy muscular man with a lot of money." "Well… you got me!"
